artist: Artist: Wenceslaus Hollar; Artist: After a follower of Hans Holbein the Younger
creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
description: Jesus at LL beseeching a small mob of men at R who carry nails, large staffs, and a candle; man behind Jesus holds a sword; cliffs, a fence, and gate in background
inscription:
Inscription

inscribed in plate at bottom: [See heere the power of Maiestie divine, / And Truth it self / when it doth clearelie shine; / For this to grownd it throwes, castes in a traunce / The Owles of darke, and blind fold ignorance.] 

numbered in plate at lower right: [2]
provenance: John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie; gave to MIA, 2015. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
title: Christ Confronting His Detractors, From the Satirical Passion
